title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement hello@damurka.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to kpp2019
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to kpp2019
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to kpp2019
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("damurka/kpp2019", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header).

text: Please note kpp2019 project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Kenya Population Projections 2019
text: kpp2019 package provides key dataset population projections Kenya 2020 2045. data based 2019 Kenya Population Housing Census subsequent projections made Kenya National Bureau Statistics (KNBS). package developed independently third party make valuable data accessible researchers, policy-makers, planners interested Kenya’s demographic trends next decades. data presented package offer insights population growth, demographic composition, migration patterns across Kenyan counties, essential designing policies, allocating resources, monitoring national development goals.

title: Kenya Population Projections 2019
text: package developed independently affiliated endorsed Kenya National Bureau Statistics (KNBS) governmental organization. data provided based publicly available projections published KNBS. detailed information official documentation, please refer original source provided “Data Sources” section .

title: Kenya Population Projections 2019
text: can install development version kpp2019 GitHub :

text: installation, can load datasets start exploring Kenya’s population projections.
code: # Load the package library(kpp2019)  # Load a dataset data("pop1")  # View the first few rows head(pop1) #>   county age year gender     pop #> 1  Kenya 0-4 2020   Male 3123737 #> 2  Kenya 0-4 2020 Female 3156282 #> 3  Kenya 0-4 2020  Total 6280019 #> 4  Kenya 0-4 2021   Male 3143314 #> 5  Kenya 0-4 2021 Female 3147353 #> 6  Kenya 0-4 2021  Total 6290667

what: Components of Population Change in Kenya (2020-2045) — components
title: Components of Population Change in Kenya (2020-2045) — components
text: dataset provides components population change Kenya several 5-year projection periods 2020 2045. dataset includes key demographic components births, deaths, natural increase, migration, along related population rates crude birth rate, crude death rate, natural increase rate, net migration rate. data structured projection period.

title: Components of Population Change in Kenya (2020-2045) — components
Components of Population Change in Kenya (2020-2045) — components
text: data frame 1,920 rows 4 variables: county Name county (factor). component demographic component measured (factor). Possible values include: Births total number births projection period. Deaths total number deaths projection period. Nat. Inc. Natural Increase: difference births deaths projection period. Net Mig. Net Migration: net number people entering leaving Kenya projection period (immigrants minus emigrants). CBR Crude Birth Rate: number births per 1,000 population per year projection period. CDR Crude Death Rate: number deaths per 1,000 population per year projection period. CNIR Crude Natural Increase Rate: difference crude birth rate crude death rate, representing natural population growth per 1,000 population per year. CNMR Crude Net Migration Rate: net migration rate, representing net number migrants per 1,000 population per year. year 5-year projection period (factor). Possible values "2020-25", "2026-30", "2031-35", "2036-40", "2041-45". value numeric value associated component specific projection period (numeric).

title: Components of Population Change in Kenya (2020-2045) — components
text: Kenya National Bureau Statistics (2023). 2019 Kenya Population Housing Census Analytical Report Population Projections. Retrieved knbs..ke.

title: Components of Population Change in Kenya (2020-2045) — components
text: dataset captures various components population change Kenya 2020 2045. allows users analyze demographic changes time, including impacts births, deaths, migration, natural increase population size. rates, crude birth rate (CBR) crude death rate (CDR), provide insights demographic trends per 1,000 population. Components Explained: Births: Total births projection period (thousands). Deaths: Total deaths projection period (thousands). Natural Increase (Nat. Inc.): Difference births deaths (thousands). Net Migration (Net Mig.): Net migration (immigrants minus emigrants) projection period (thousands). Crude Birth Rate (CBR): Births per 1,000 people per year. Crude Death Rate (CDR): Deaths per 1,000 people per year. Crude Natural Increase Rate (CNIR): Natural increase per 1,000 people per year (CBR minus CDR). Crude Net Migration Rate (CNMR): Net migration per 1,000 people per year.

title: Components of Population Change in Kenya (2020-2045) — components
code: data(components) head(components) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   county component year      value #>   <fct>  <fct>     <fct>     <dbl> #> 1 Kenya  Births    2020-25 6404408 #> 2 Kenya  Births    2026-30 6460085 #> 3 Kenya  Births    2031-35 6475904 #> 4 Kenya  Births    2036-40 6461490 #> 5 Kenya  Births    2041-45 6418919 #> 6 Kenya  Deaths    2020-25 1890966 summary(components) #>              county       component        year         value         #>  Baringo        :  40   Births :240   2020-25:384   Min.   : -29286   #>  Bomet          :  40   CBR    :240   2026-30:384   1st Qu.:      6   #>  Bungoma        :  40   CDR    :240   2031-35:384   Median :     21   #>  Busia          :  40   CNIR   :240   2036-40:384   Mean   :  67132   #>  Elgeyo-Marakwet:  40   CNMR   :240   2041-45:384   3rd Qu.:  50576   #>  Embu           :  40   Deaths :240                 Max.   :6475904   #>  (Other)        :1680   (Other):480                                    # Example: Plot the number of births over the projection periods for Kenya library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union births <- components %>%   filter(component == "Births", county == 'Kenya') ggplot(births, aes(x = factor(year, ordered = TRUE), y = value, group = county)) +   geom_line() +   geom_point() +   labs(     title = "Projected Births in Kenya (2020-2045)",     x = "Projection Period",     y = "Number of Births"   ) +   theme_minimal()

what: Base and Projected Age Distributions in Kenya (2020-2035, Annual Increments) — pop1
title: Base and Projected Age Distributions in Kenya (2020-2035, Annual Increments) — pop1
text: dataset provides base projected population distributions county, age group, gender, year Kenya 2020 2035 annual increments. includes population estimates derived 2019 Kenya Population Housing Census subsequent projections Kenya National Bureau Statistics (KNBS).

title: Base and Projected Age Distributions in Kenya (2020-2035, Annual Increments) — pop1
Base and Projected Age Distributions in Kenya (2020-2035, Annual Increments) — pop1
text: data frame 41,424 rows 5 variables: county Name county Kenya age Age group 5-year intervals (e.g., "0-4", "5-9", ..., "80+") year Year population estimate gender Gender category ("Male", "Female", "Total") pop Estimated population count specified county, age group, gender, year

title: Base and Projected Age Distributions in Kenya (2020-2035, Annual Increments) — pop1
text: Kenya National Bureau Statistics (2023). 2019 Kenya Population Housing Census Analytical Report Population Projections. Retrieved knbs..ke.

title: Base and Projected Age Distributions in Kenya (2020-2035, Annual Increments) — pop1
text: pop1 dataset can used analyse demographic trends, plan resource allocation, study population dynamics Kenya specified years. projections take account factors fertility rates, mortality rates, migration patterns. age groups provided 5-year intervals, population estimates updated annually 2020 2035. Note: "Total" gender category represents combined population males females. "Ages" age category represents combined ages age groups.

title: Base and Projected Age Distributions in Kenya (2020-2035, Annual Increments) — pop1
code: data(pop1) head(pop1) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   county age    year gender     pop #>   <fct>  <fct> <int> <fct>    <dbl> #> 1 Kenya  0-4    2020 Male   3123737 #> 2 Kenya  0-4    2020 Female 3156282 #> 3 Kenya  0-4    2020 Total  6280019 #> 4 Kenya  0-4    2021 Male   3143314 #> 5 Kenya  0-4    2021 Female 3147353 #> 6 Kenya  0-4    2021 Total  6290667 summary(pop1) #>              county           age             year         gender      #>  Baringo        :  864   5-9    : 2304   Min.   :2020   Female:13808   #>  Bomet          :  864   10-14  : 2304   1st Qu.:2024   Male  :13808   #>  Bungoma        :  864   15-19  : 2304   Median :2028   Total :13808   #>  Busia          :  864   20-24  : 2304   Mean   :2028                  #>  Elgeyo-Marakwet:  864   25-29  : 2304   3rd Qu.:2031                  #>  Embu           :  864   30-34  : 2304   Max.   :2035                  #>  (Other)        :36240   (Other):27600                                 #>       pop           #>  Min.   :     386   #>  1st Qu.:   10984   #>  Median :   32576   #>  Mean   :  171194   #>  3rd Qu.:   73208   #>  Max.   :62164808   #>                      # Example: Plotting the population distribution for Nairobi County in 2020 library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) kenya_2020 <- pop1 %>%   filter(county == "Nairobi City", year == 2020, gender == "Total", age != 'All Ages') ggplot(kenya_2020, aes(x = age, y = pop)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   labs(     title = "Population Distribution in Nairobi County (2020)",     x = "Age Group",     y = "Population"   ) +   theme_minimal()

Base and Projected Age Distributions in Kenya (2020-2045, Five-Year Increments) — pop5
text: data frame 15,552 rows 5 variables: county Name county Kenya age Age group 5-year intervals (e.g., "0-4", "5-9", ..., "80+") year Year population estimate gender Gender category ("Male", "Female", "Total") pop Estimated population count specified county, age group, gender, year

text: Kenya National Bureau Statistics (2023). 2019 Kenya Population Housing Census Analytical Report Population Projections. Retrieved knbs..ke.

title: Base and Projected Age Distributions in Kenya (2020-2045, Five-Year Increments) — pop5
text: pop5 dataset can used analyse demographic trends, plan resource allocation, study population dynamics Kenya specified years. projections take account factors fertility rates, mortality rates, migration patterns. age groups provided 5-year intervals, population estimates available five-year increments 2020 2045. Note: "Total" gender category represents combined population males females. "Ages" age category represents combined ages age groups.

title: Base and Projected Age Distributions in Kenya (2020-2045, Five-Year Increments) — pop5
code: data(pop5) head(pop5) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   county age    year gender     pop #>   <fct>  <fct> <int> <fct>    <dbl> #> 1 Kenya  0-4    2020 Male   3123737 #> 2 Kenya  0-4    2020 Female 3156282 #> 3 Kenya  0-4    2020 Total  6280019 #> 4 Kenya  0-4    2025 Male   3221623 #> 5 Kenya  0-4    2025 Female 3111637 #> 6 Kenya  0-4    2025 Total  6333261 summary(pop5) #>              county           age             year         gender     #>  Baringo        :  324   0-4    :  864   Min.   :2020   Female:5184   #>  Bomet          :  324   5-9    :  864   1st Qu.:2025   Male  :5184   #>  Bungoma        :  324   10-14  :  864   Median :2032   Total :5184   #>  Busia          :  324   15-19  :  864   Mean   :2032                 #>  Elgeyo-Marakwet:  324   20-24  :  864   3rd Qu.:2040                 #>  Embu           :  324   25-29  :  864   Max.   :2045                 #>  (Other)        :13608   (Other):10368                                #>       pop           #>  Min.   :     386   #>  1st Qu.:   12778   #>  Median :   36744   #>  Mean   :  184471   #>  3rd Qu.:   78528   #>  Max.   :70179943   #>                      # Example: Plotting the population distribution for Mombasa County in 2025 library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) mombasa_2025 <- pop5 %>%   filter(county == "Mombasa", year == 2025, gender == "Total", age != 'All Ages') ggplot(mombasa_2025, aes(x = age, y = pop)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   labs(     title = "Population Distribution in Mombasa County (2025)",     x = "Age Group",     y = "Population"   ) +   theme_minimal()
